messages.message: I'm sorry but I only want atheist friends on Facebook.

Brian
Me too!
Oh. I didn't see anything secular on your feed but found a couple of religious things. My bad.

Brian
Oh, don't mind those, that was just a test.
A test?

Brian
A test.  This is all a test.  Thank you for participating! 
Pretty neat huh?
You lost me.

Brian
Crap.
Moving too fast.

Lol.
So you don't believe in a god, correct?

Brian
I do and I don't.
What reasons do you have to want to hold on to a belief in god?

Brian
I am a scientist, I want to prove it to you.
I would love to see evidence for the existence of a god. Science has proven that a god was not needed in creation.

Brian
I would too.  But I can tell you what I have learned and maybe it will blow your mind.

Ok.
You can't believe everything that you find on the internet. If I searched hard enough I could probably find evidence for aliens and Bigfoot too.

Brian

That is my calendar.  The gray areas are the fringe parts.
I am documenting "coincidences" and how they lead to opportunities.
For example, if you had a job for a software developer like me, and I was really successful.  Would this conversation be a coincidence or an opportunity?
I can only prove that my entire life I was being managed by the "feeling of love" at the end of my life.  We finally have the technology to keep track.
I thought we were talking about god beliefs?

Brian
I think I am a god, and if I act like it I can prove it using productivity, and I am a scientist which means I will spend my entire life trying to prove it.  That was Jesus' ambition too.

So you are Mormon?
You get your own planet after you die too?

Brian
I also got pantheist today, interesting, why would you say that?
Perhaps my own planet is just a state of mind, I didn't know that about Mormons, this is new information.
I think that's what they believe.

Brian
What about scientologist?
They are nuts too. Lol

Brian
I agree.
But what if we are aliens because our DNA comes from somewhere else?
They have to traumatize people to make them more effective.
We are made of stardust and to other life forms in the galaxy, we are the aliens.

Brian
So you share at least one thing in common with them.
If they had the technology to reach us, we would have some proof of it by now.

Brian
Oh.  Maybe they are trapped?  Maybe they died?
That's a lot of if's and maybe's coming from a scientist. Thanks for blowing my mind.

Brian
Ha!  I see news related to all of those questions but I don't see answers.  Let me know if you want more.
There are a lot of unanswered questions, why create more questions?

Brian
So we can prioritize the hardest one.
The hardest one is the existence of a god.

Brian
I agree.  But how can we find that answer unless we first understand God's mindset?

God was created to help explain why things happened at a time when science wasn't there to help explain how things work.
There is no need for a creator, the idea does not exist outside of your imagination.

Brian
Exactly what I have been thinking for a very long time.
We need empowerment and autonomy not governance and politics.
But not everyone is as smart as us, so how to we wield it?
Take religion out of schools and replace it with more science education.

Brian
I agree.  But slightly different.  Apply science to every field individually, redesign history class to meditation and mindfulness and we can end violence today.
Apply science to every religion and we will find the really hard answers that haven't survived catastrophic events.

Good luck on your search for the truth. Maybe someone in my debate group can help you on your journey.
http://www.facebook.com/groups/DefiningTheTruth
Attachment Unavailable
This attachment may have been removed or the person who shared it may not have permission to share it with you.

Brian
Nice job.  That is new to me.  Your ambition transcends you and I am getting to your level!
I have searched deep for the answers and came back atheist.

Brian
I appreciate that.  I am having a conversation with a physicist about love right now.  Love is god.  That is all you need to know.  Doesn't matter if you believe me 
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lorentz_transformation
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pioneer_anomaly
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gravity_assist

Time don't travel... And time depends on the density of energy at the concrete point of measuring
Angel Lopez Simon
Lorentz transformation - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
In physics, the Lorentz transformation (or transformations) are coordinate transformations between two coordinate frames that move at constant velocity relative to each other.
en.wikipedia.org
Now you know as much about physics as that person.
